info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 12 at 7:23PM MST until December 14 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PLAINS BLIZZARD DEVELOPING BY TUESDAY MORNING... .A strong winter storm system will produce blizzard conditions over northeastern Colorado late tonight through Tuesday. Strong winds are expected to gust up to 60 mph. The heaviest snow is expected to be on the plains east of Greeley and Denver, focusing toward the Akron, Sterling, and possibly Fort Morgan areas. If you are planning travel north or east of Denver Tuesday, you should consider changing your plans to avoid travel during the day on Thursday. Travel will be difficult to impossible and road closures are likely. Those with outdoor livestock interests should prepare now for likely blizzard conditions on Tuesday and continued cold and windy weather behind the storm Wednesday and Thursday. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MST TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Briggsdale, Fort Morgan, Byers, Sterling, and Akron. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to Midnight MST Tuesday Night. * IMPACTS...Visibility will be near zero at times resulting in white out conditions. Travel will be treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Road closures and impassable roads are likely.
info.instruction: Consider altering your travel plans. Heavy snowfall is expected to make travel very difficult to impossible.
